newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures end off lows after Dow drop.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures end off lows after Dow drop.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures ended weak but off their lows on Monday after opening sharply down following the Dow's second-biggest point drop in history.
Dealers said the Nikkei showed scope for a technical rebound but any rises were likely to be limited in size and duration.
"There was some buying in the last half hour after the follow-through selling from the Dow. But generally sentiment for the Nikkei is still weak," a trader at a U.S. institution said.
The lead Nikkei 225 September contract lost 380 points to end at 19,050 after falling as low as 18,800.
"We should have a technical rebound to maybe 19,200 tomorrow and then it'll come off again," a senior dealer at a Japanese institution said.
He said the 18,800 level could provide short-term support but the September Nikkei was likely to target a low of 18,500.
The Dow lost 247 points to 7,695 on Friday as the dollar's weakness and concerns about U.S. corporate earnings spurred heavy sales of U.S. stocks.
Taiwan stock index futures were not traded as Taipei markets were closed due to a typhoon.
